title: Macbook Pro Retina 820-4924. Pulsing PM_SLP_S4
message:
Macbook Pro retina 820-4924

[B]ISSUE:[/B]
[LIST=1]
[*]Pulsing PM_SLP_S4_L on DMM. from 0.02v to 2.9v and then 0.02v
[*]CPU/PCH internal voltage regulators 1.05V is pulsing on DMM.
[*]No fan Spin
[/LIST]
[B]Troubleshooting done: [/B]
Checked the following power rails. All of them have 3.3v as it should be and clock is OK.

[B]Question:[/B]
Suspect a bad PCH/CPU??

title: Macbook Pro Retina 820-4924. Pulsing PM_SLP_S4
message:
Check if PM_SLP_S3/0_L also pulse.
And check for pulse at all big coils too.

"No fan Spin"
Not relevant on this board for diagnose; fan starts very late, when CPU gets really hot.

Any history available?
PCH_RESET_L pulses?

title: Macbook Pro Retina 820-4924. Pulsing PM_SLP_S4
message:
Thanks 2informaticos:  See following pls.
[LIST=1]
[*]PM_SLP_S3 = PULSES
[*]PM_SLP_S0 = PULSES AS WELL.
[*]PCH_SRTCRST= 3.3V
[*]PLT_RST = 0V
[/LIST]
Bad PCH/CPU?

No history unfortunately on this one.

title: Macbook Pro Retina 820-4924. Pulsing PM_SLP_S4
message:
You should get pulse at all big coils then; maybe not CPU ones.
Check what happens at pins 7 & 3 of U1950.
